meanings.definition: Treat (iron or steel) with carbon at high temperature to improve hardness and strength.
meanings.sent1: The blacksmith will carburise the metal to make it stronger.
meanings.sent2: It is common practice to carburise steel for industrial applications.
meanings.sent3: Why did the metalworker bring a magnifying glass to carburise the steel? To see things more clearly!
meanings.sent4: The process of carburising the steel is like giving it a protective armor of carbon.
meanings.sent5: The fiery furnace roared as it worked to carburise the iron, transforming it into a robust material.
